I am heading on a cross-country tour to B.C., Ontario and Alberta to discuss the importance of the Trans Mountain pipeline expansion.There is not a school, hospital, road or bike lane anywhere in the country that doesn’t owe something to oil and gas. Pipelines are just as critical for jobs and economies across the country as they are for Alberta, and to stifle the oil and gas industry would be economically negligent. I will continue engaging with people across the country until this project becomes a reality, making life better throughout Canada.The Conference Board of Canada estimates the Trans Mountain pipeline expansion project will create 15,000 construction jobs and 37,000 operational jobs per year. The project has approval from the federal and British Columbia governments, but continues to face local and legal challenges.I’ll offer Alberta’s perspective on the pressing need to open new markets for Alberta’s energy products through the twinning of the Trans Mountain Pipeline – a project that is critical to the national economy. I will also provide an update on Alberta’s Climate Leadership Plan – the most comprehensive in North America – and speak about how Alberta is effectively promoting jobs and economic opportunity with meaningful environmental action.The speaking engagements are:Empire Club of Canada, Toronto: Nov. 20. Economic Club of Canada, Ottawa: Nov. 21 Calgary Chamber of Commerce, Calgary: Nov. 24Greater Vancouver Board of Trade, Vancouver: Nov. 30 Edmonton Chamber of Commerce, Edmonton: Dec. 7. https://www.facebook.com/rachelnotley/

We are ensuring students can form gay-straight alliances at school without fear of being outed, by introducing Bill 24: An Act to Support Gay-Straight Alliances.  Our top priority is for all schools across Alberta to be safe and welcoming for all students, regardless of their sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. We have heard from countless students that being part of a GSA made them feel safe and accepted. If passed, the bill would: - Require all publicly funded schools to create welcoming, caring and respectful policies and make them publicly available.- Strengthen the minister’s ability to ensure every school complies with the law.- Protect the privacy of students that join a GSA or QSA.- Protect the establishment of GSAs from political interference.- Ensure principals help students create a GSA or QSA in a timely manner. https://www.facebook.com/rachelnotley/

Bill 23 is a response to a court order to further protect Albertans from age discrimination when it comes to any goods, services, accommodation or facilities normally available to the public are provided and tenancy.If passed, Bill 23 will allow seniors-only housing to continue without violating the act, with a minimum age cut-off of 55. We recognize that older Albertans may choose to live together in a community of people at a similar stage in life.Existing age-restricted condominiums would be granted a 15-year transition period to provide affected Albertans with substantial notice. If Bill 23 is passed, age restrictions in rental accommodations will no longer be permitted as of January 1, 2018, unless the restriction is set at 55 of over. We will protect programs and activities that provide a benefit to minors and seniors, such as discounted movie tickets, and seniors’ or children’s menus at a restaurant. It will also protect ameliorative programs and activities that are in place to improve situations for disadvantaged people. https://www.facebook.com/rachelnotley/

November is Family Violence Prevention Month in Alberta. Together, we can end family violence in our communities. Dear PC Members.The PC Party committed to the largest policy consultation in our party’s history.  This comprehensive consultation process included proposals from members, stakeholders, organizations, and individuals across the province.  The Policy Advisory Council members reviewed all the policy submission and shortened it to 139 policy resolutions for membership to vote on.  As a current member of the party, you should have received a letter in the mail with the instructions on how to register to vote on the 139 policy resolutions. If you have not received the letter, please call the Voter Helpline at 1 888-281-8683. You need to register at www.pcporegister.isivote.com/ and enter the registration PIN provided in the letter you received and the telephone number on file.  Registration is open for 4 days, and you can register to participate from October 17th, 9:00 am to October 20th, 11:59 pm. Online voting starts on November 2nd, 9:00 am to November 6th at midnight.  To vote, visit www.pcpovote.isivote.com/   and enter your voting PIN that you received by email and your email address.  Key Dates-REGISTER TO VOTE – October 17th to October 20thTELEPHONE TOWNHALLS – October 26th to November 1stVOTE ONLINE – November 2nd to November 6thATTEND THE CONVENTION – November 25th https://www.facebook.com/samueloosterhoff/

My last speech to Parliament:Mr. Speaker, let me start by saying how overwhelmingly optimistic I am about the future of this country, optimistic because over the past nine years, I have seen the stature of our country grow in the eyes of the world. The world has seen and come to know and to count on Canada’s strength, strength created by sustained economic growth and by our enduring values. Strength through our commitment to freedom, democracy, human rights, and the rule of law. Simply put, the world has seen, in fact the world continues to see, the best that Canada has to offer.When I joined my good friend Mike Harris back in 1995, I was perhaps just a little naive, driven by ideology, defined by partisanship, at the age of 25. I quickly learned, though, that to make a difference, to really make a difference, you cannot be defined by partisanship, nor by ideology. You need instead, to be defined by your values. I believed then, and I continue to believe, that government has to be there for people. And that through hard work, it can be a force for good.When each of us chooses to enter public life, we do so united in one simple desire. The desire to leave behind a better country, a better province, and a better community. To pass on to the next generation a better place than the one we inherited from those who came before us.And now today, after serving 10 years in provincial politics, 10 years here in federal politics, in 10 ministerial portfolios, and with more grey hairs than I choose to admit, I can step back and say that we have an Ottawa that is vibrant and strong. A province whose future is bright and hopeful, with strong health care and an innovative and resilient workforce. A country that is the best in the world. We have led the G7 in job creation, and we have been a beacon of dependable light in a world that is roiled by far too many dark and stormy seas.Today Canada stands tall in the world. United with our allies and partners in the fight against terror. Side by side with the only liberal democracy in the Middle East. Strong relationships in the Arab world. Firm in our objection to militaristic expansionism in Eastern Europe. An expanded diplomatic footprint in Asia. And strong trade ties that will create lasting prosperity for generations to come. Canada stands tall in the world.Mr Speaker, last night I spoke to the Prime Minister and informed him that I was standing down from Cabinet. I expressed my intention not to run in the next general election in the new riding of Nepean. And I also expressed my intention to stand down as Member of Parliament for Ottawa West—Nepean in the weeks ahead.I will miss this place very much, and many of the people in it, on all sides. But the time has come for me to start a new chapter in my life. If the House will indulge me, I would like to extend my profound gratitude and admiration to a few individuals who really made a difference for me.To my family – thank you for always being at and on my side. It is never easy to see one’s son, grandson, brother, or uncle under the public’s microscope. Not only have you been my strength during the difficult times, you have kept me grounded during the good ones.Through you Mr Speaker, to the Prime Minister. In 2005 when I was a younger, somewhat thinner provincial MPP, when many others counted him out I believed in this Prime Minister and I continue to believe in him today all these years later. There is no better person to lead our country into its 150th year. He is one of our country’s great leaders. I leave, genuinely humbled to have enjoyed his confidence and truly honoured to have served with him; profoundly grateful to have sat in his Cabinet all these years and immensely proud of what we have been able to accomplish together for all Canadians. I am also distinctly privileged to count him as a friend and a mentor. I wish him and our party continued success for many years to come, and I look forward to campaigning for him and my colleagues in our party in the upcoming general election.To all of my friends in this place: for a Canadian there is nothing more meaningful and nothing more special than to sit in the benches of this sacred House and to serve with all of you. I am grateful to you for you friendship, for your counsel and for your wisdom. John Diefenbaker once said, that “Parliament is more than a procedure, it is the custodian of the nation’s freedom”. There is no greater honour for a Canadian than to serve in this place; no greater honour to serve the people who place their trust in us.For my staff, past and present: It is said that behind any successful minister are great staff and that is truly the case for me. I want to thank all of the staff and security in the House of Commons for their continued service to our democratic traditions. For the public service in all the portfolios I have served in and for our diplomats abroad. I leave with the feeling that my political career has been one of success in delivering real results for Canadians from coast to coast to coast. I thank all of you, from the bottom of my heart, for standing by my side and for your valued contributions to our country.Finally and most importantly, to the people of Ottawa West—Nepean, the people of Nepean and the people of Ottawa: thank you.I am grateful for your continued trust, your vision, your community. Your support over these past 20 years means more than I ever can say in words. Being foreign minister was a tremendous experience, but I never took your trust for granted. I never forgot about our city. Every day I was reminded that it was you who put your trust in me and gave me this incredible opportunity.I was always committed to our people and its future, and I am so grateful for the volunteers in countless campaigns and riding associations; anyone who believed in me, in our party, in our government and, most importantly, in our message. Thank you.I stand before the House with many emotions. I am optimistic about Canada’s future as a country. I am optimistic about my future and the opportunities that lie before me. At the same time, I am very saddened to leave this place behind. I am saddened to leave behind those for whom I care so deeply. I am grateful for the opportunity to serve my country, proud of the legacy of our government and honoured to have had the opportunity to stand in this place.May the true North stay strong and free, and may God bless Canada. Thank you. https://www.facebook.com/honjohnbaird/

The end of 2014 marks the close of an unprecedented year in the fight for freedom and security around the world. We saw Russia rip up international law and use a military invasion to annex part of a sovereign nation. We saw ISIL and all its gruesome brutality spread like a cancer through Iraq and Syria. And we saw Hamas terrorists try to instill fear in the Israeli people by deliberately targeting civilians with thousands of rockets and mortar shells through the air and with tunnels of terror underground.Canada has always approached global challenges from a principled position. We believe that the Kremlin’s expansionism flies in the face of decades of international order and must be confronted. This is why Canada has answered Ukrainians’ calls for help in maintaining their freedom and democracy and why Canada has led efforts to isolate Russia economically and politically. We believe that ISIL's actions against innocent civilians in Iraq and Syria, including members of religious and ethnic minorities, are barbaric. ISIL's expansion is a threat to international peace and security, and to Canada and Canadians. This is why Canada has joined the international coalition fighting against ISIL in Iraq, it is why we have worked to protect religious minorities and it is why we have delivered much-needed humanitarian assistance to those fleeing the violence in Iraq and Syria. And we believe that there is no moral equivalence between liberal democracies and terrorist groups, which is why we have strongly supported Israel’s right to defend itself by itself.But while the world may seem more tumultuous than ever, there have been rays of hope and progress from all corners. Under the leadership of Prime Minister Stephen Harper, Canada is saving the lives of millions of mothers and children across the globe with the Maternal, Newborn and Child Health Initiative. Canada has also led the charge at the UN and around the world in the cause of ending child, early and forced marriage and on standing with the people of Iran and North Korea. Elsewhere—from Burma to Tunisia to Afghanistan and places in between—Canada has nurtured the flame of democracy so that others may enjoy the freedoms that we in Canada are blessed with.Canadians can be proud of the role their country has played around the world in 2014. We have stood up strongly abroad for Canadian values and interests and the principles that make our country strong and free and the envy of the world. https://www.facebook.com/honjohnbaird/

Canada has long held the view that every diplomatic measure should be taken to ensure Iran never obtains the capacity to sprint to nuclear weapons capability. Yesterday, I was honoured to rise in the House in recognition of a great Canadian, Mr. Warren Allmand. A tireless defender of human rights both in Canada and abroad, Warren served as a Liberal MP for over three decades (1965-1997), while also acting as Solicitor General and Minister of Indian and Northern Affairs. Among Allmand’s great achievements was the successful oversight of the abolition of the death penalty in Canada in 1976. After leaving federal politics, Allmand was President of the International Centre for Human Rights and Democratic Development and the World Federalist Movement-Canada. Allmand returned to politics and served as a City Councillor for the City of Montréal (2005-2009), where he helped draft and oversee the implementation of the city’s landmark Charter of Rights. Moreover, he is known internationally for his work to fight mass atrocities and for upholding Canada’s Responsibility to Protect doctrine. World Federalist Movement Montreal Institute for Genocide and Human Rights Studies https://www.facebook.com/ali.ehsassi/

Dear fellow citizens,As we mark the sesquicentennial of our Confederation, we as Canadians should stop to reflect upon how fortunate we are. In an era of unprecedented global wealth and opportunity, there is simply no better place to live.While it may be tempting to congratulate ourselves for this blessed state of affairs, our gratitude should instead go to those who came before us and built so much of what we have. It starts with acknowledging the leadership and wisdom of Sir John A. Macdonald, Sir George-Étienne Cartier and their colleagues. Coming together in a time of great danger, they constructed a system that would allow British, French, Aboriginal and Immigrant to unite, while preserving their unique institutions, languages, cultures and faiths. That achievement is, despite the youthfulness of our country, one of the most enduring models of democratic governance in the world today.Generations of men and women have since added their own stories to the annals of our history. Through wise decisions, hard work and sacrifice, they built our economy, developed our society and enhanced our liberty. Consecrating those triumphs are the tens of thousands of Canadians who made the ultimate sacrifice for our country in distant lands, fighting to ensure that the great evils of the past 150 years did not come to our shores.A full appreciation of all we have been given should also lead us to embrace our own responsibilities to those who follow. Are we also ready to take the hard decisions rather than the easy paths? Are we prepared to dedicate ourselves to great causes in the face of grave challenges? Are we willing to make sacrifices in our own time so that our descendants will continue to enjoy our freedoms in theirs?If our answers to these questions are yes, and our actions bear out those convictions, then we can be assured that, in another 150 years, Canada will be even stronger and better than it is today.God bless Canada,Rt. Hon. Stephen Harper22nd Prime Minister of Canada https://www.facebook.com/RtHonStephenHarper/

Laureen and I wish to extend our sincere congratulations and deep gratitude to the Honourable Rona Ambrose as she announces her decision to leave public life.  Rona is a dear friend, an outstanding public servant, and a proud Conservative.  Her remarkable career spanned 13 years in Parliament, during which time she was elected on five separate occasions,  held five senior cabinet portfolios, and served as the Interim Leader of the Conservative Party of Canada, and Leader of Her Majesty’s Loyal Opposition in Parliament. As Prime Minister, I had the privilege of appointing Rona to some of the most complex and challenging cabinet portfolios in Government. Between 2006 and 2015 Rona served as Minister of Environment, Minister of Intergovernmental Affairs, Minister of Labour, Minister of Western Economic Diversification, Minister of Public Works and Government Services, Minister for Status of Women and Minister of Health. Rona’s contributions to our government, both publicly and privately, were many.  Yet despite a heavy workload, Rona always retained her warm and charming manner and down to earth Alberta humour. Rona’s highly capable leadership of the Conservative team has set a high bar for those who will follow.  Yet her commitment to defending our values reaches well beyond her Parliamentary career.  Rona has been a passionate and articulate advocate for the rights of women and girls. As Minister for the Status of Women, Rona sponsored a resolution at the United Nations recognizing October 11 as International Day of the Girl. This effort to enhance awareness of gender equality, equal access to education, health care, and protection from violence for all girls around the globe stands as a lasting testament to Rona’s efforts. On behalf of Laureen and our family, we could not be more proud as we thank Rona and JP for their years of hard work and dedication to Canada and the Conservative Party, and we wish them continued happiness and success in the next chapter of their lives. https://www.facebook.com/RtHonStephenHarper/

It is with heavy hearts and immense sadness that Laureen and I learned of the sudden passing of our dear friend, colleague and extraordinary Canadian, Shaun Webb. Shaun has been a longtime friend and trusted advisor whose immeasurable knowledge, dedication, quick wit and gentle manner will be long and sorely missed. Shaun joined the Conservative team in Ottawa in 2008 as Legislative Assistant to former Member of Parliament for North Vancouver, Andrew Saxton. From 2010 to 2015 he served in the Prime Minister's Office as my Regional Affairs Advisor for his native British Columbia, and the three Territories. Shaun was blessed with intellectual curiosity, an encyclopedic memory, and an impressive capacity for bringing facts and original insight to bear on complicated issues.  As a result, he became a sought-after resource for colleagues throughout the Prime Minister’s Office, myself included, and made a direct contribution to a wide range of policy files.  In recent months I have continued to lean on Shaun’s invaluable expertise and deeply rooted understanding of Western and Northern Canada in his capacity as an Associate at my firm Harper & Associates. I am proud to have had someone like Shaun on my team: a hard-working, thoughtful colleague whose love for Canada was at the core of who he was. I know that Laureen and I mourn Shaun’s young life along with countless friends, parliamentarians past and present, and colleagues and acquaintances across our nation. Shaun and his mother Felicity are in our prayers during this very difficult time. https://www.facebook.com/RtHonStephenHarper/

Laureen and I were shocked and saddened to learn of the death of our friend and colleague Jim Prentice, a devoted public servant, loving husband, father and grandfather. Jim’s life was an inspirational story of achievement and sacrifice. A man born of modest means who worked in coal mines to fund his way through university, his success in business and law was a testament to his personal tenacity, while his turn to elected office was a tribute to his sense of public service. In cabinet, his patience and perseverance in tackling some of Ottawa’s most challenging portfolios was rivalled only by the depth of knowledge and insight he brought to his assignments - qualities he took to his tenure as premier of Alberta.I will never forget Jim’s graciousness in 2002, when he, then the Progressive Conservative nominee in Calgary-Southwest, sacrificed his own candidacy to assist my return to Parliament. This was a reflection of his dedication to the conservative cause and to conservative unity, of which he would become a champion at both levels of government.A career in politics can be gruelling and it can be thankless. Many believe they can overcome or escape these challenges, but few openly embrace them, comforted by the knowledge that their purpose is something greater than themselves. Jim was such a person, and today we mourn and pray for the family of one of this country’s great servants, whose life has been cut short by such tragic circumstances. https://www.facebook.com/RtHonStephenHarper/

Laureen et moi avons été choqués et attristés d’apprendre le décès de notre ami et ancien collègue Jim Prentice, un homme au service de ses concitoyens, un mari, un père et un grand-père dévoué.La vie de Jim est une histoire inspirante de réalisations et de sacrifice. Issu d’un milieu modeste, Jim a travaillé dans les mines de charbon pour financer ses études universitaires, son succès en affaires et en droit n’est pas étranger à sa ténacité personnelle, alors qu’il a pu mettre en pratique son sens du service public pendant sa carrière politique. Au Cabinet, sa patience et sa persévérance n’avaient d’égales que sa profondeur et sa perspicacité lorsqu’il s’affairait à gérer des dossiers complexes à Ottawa – toutes des qualités qu’il a emmenées avec lui en Alberta à titre de premier ministre de la province.Je n’oublierai jamais la grâce dont a fait preuve Jim lorsqu’en 2002, il a sacrifié sa candidature pour le Parti progressiste-conservateur dans Calgary-Southwest pour faciliter mon retour au Parlement. Ce geste est le reflet de son dévouement à la cause conservatrice et à sa volonté d’unir les conservateurs. Il aura défendu cette cause aux deux paliers de gouvernement.Une carrière en politique peut être éprouvante et ingrate. Plusieurs croient pouvoir surmonter ou fuir ses contraintes, mais très peu les acceptent en sachant que la cause qu’ils servent est quelque chose de plus grand qu’eux-mêmes. Pourtant, c’est ce que Jim a fait et aujourd’hui, nos pensées vont vers la famille d’un des plus grands serviteurs que notre pays ait connu, dont la vie a été écourtée par des circonstances tragiques. https://www.facebook.com/RtHonStephenHarper/

Laureen and I were saddened today to learn of the passing of President Shimon Peres, a towering figure in the history of the State of Israel and one of the great statesmen of our age.Shimon Peres’ long and distinguished political career was animated by a tireless spirit of patriotism, faith, and public service. His was a life of sacrifice not only for his country and its citizens, but the very idea of Israel — the dream of a safe and prosperous Jewish state able to live in confident peace with its neighbours. Defeat and setback never deterred him, and his quiet humility and perseverance made him a model of dignity and an inspiration to the world. As a man who served his government in so many different capacities over so many decades, he demonstrated it was indeed possible to transcend the myopic world of politics in the pursuit of permanent ideals.I was honoured to meet Shimon Peres several times during the course of my own public life, and was consistently moved by his depth of knowledge and strength of character. It seemed remarkably appropriate that he was asked to spend his final years holding Israel’s highest office, a position perfectly suited for a man who had come to so thoroughly embody the spirit, values, and virtues of the remarkable nation to which he devoted his life. https://www.facebook.com/RtHonStephenHarper/

Laureen et moi avons été attristés d'apprendre aujourd'hui le décès du président Shimon Peres, un monument de l'histoire de l'État d'Israël et un des grands hommes d'État de notre époque. La longue et distinguée carrière politique de Shimon Peres était animée d'un esprit patriotique, de foi et de service public. Il s'est sacrifié non seulement pour son pays et ses citoyens, mais également pour l'idée même d'Israël - le rêve d'un État juif sécuritaire, prospère et en paix avec ses voisins. La défaite et les reculs ne l'ont jamais arrêté et sa persévérance a fait de lui un modèle de dignité et d'inspiration pour le monde. En servant son gouvernement dans différents rôles au cours des dernières décennies, il a démontré qu'il est possible de transcender le monde politique et l'atteinte d'idéaux permanents. J'ai eu l'honneur de rencontrer M. Peres à plusieurs occasions au cours de ma carrière publique et j'ai été impressionné par la profondeur de ses connaissances et sa force de caractère. Il me semble approprié qu'il ait servi comme président lors de ses dernières années, une position faite sur mesure pour un homme qui incarnait l'esprit, les valeurs et les vertus d'une nation remarquable à laquelle il a consacré sa vie. https://www.facebook.com/RtHonStephenHarper/

Salutations chers concitoyens et concitoyennes. Aujourd’hui, je souhaite vous informer que je démissionne à titre de député de Calgary Heritage. Pendant presque dix-huit ans, j’ai eu cet immense honneur de représenter Calgary au sein de notre Parlement. Je suis reconnaissant et touché d’avoir reçu votre appui et votre confiance à sept reprises. Et je quitte la vie politique fier de ce que notre équipe a accompli ensemble. Nous avons uni tous les conservateurs sous une seule bannière. Nous avons baissé les taxes et les impôts, nous avons fait des investissements critiques et nous avons équilibré le budget fédéral. Nous avons placé les droits des victimes avant ceux des criminels. Et notre préoccupation pour les familles était au cœur de nos politiques. Nous avons su gérer notre économie alors qu’elle traversait la pire récession mondiale depuis la Grande Dépression et en sommes ressortis plus forts que jamais. Nous avons adopté des positions de principe dans un monde complexe et dangereux. Et, que ce soit au Canada ou à l’étranger, nous étions toujours fiers de défendre notre pays. Chers amis, nous avons beaucoup accompli ensemble. Mais je sais que le meilleur reste à venir. Notre pays doit continuer à servir comme modèle de prospérité et de liberté. Continuez à défendre les principes pour lesquels nous nous sommes battus ici au Canada et à l’étranger. Et nos enfants, et les enfants de nos enfants, hériteront du Canada que nous connaissons et aimons tant. Alors que je fais mes adieux au Parlement du Canada et me prépare pour le prochain chapitre de ma vie. J’aimerais exprimer ma reconnaissance éternelle aux électeurs de Calgary Heritage, aux membres du Parti conservateur et à tous les Canadiens et Canadiennes pour m’avoir donnél’honneur de servir le meilleur pays au monde. En vous souhaitant beaucoup de succès à l’avenir, Merci. https://www.facebook.com/RtHonStephenHarper/

Greetings, fellow Calgarians and fellow Canadians.Today I wish to inform you that I am stepping down as the Member of Parliament for Calgary Heritage.  For a total of nearly eighteen years, I have had the tremendous honour of representing Calgary in the Parliament of Canada.  On seven occasions, I have been deeply humbled by your trust and support, time and again. And I leave elected office proud of what our team accomplished together.We united all Conservatives behind our agenda. We cut taxes, made critical investments and balanced the national budget. We got tough on crime and put families first.  We managed our G7 economy through the worst global recession since the Great Depression, and came out in the strongest position of them all. We took principled decisions in a complex and dangerous world. And, whether at home or abroad, we were always proud to stand up for Canada.  Friends, we did a lot together, but I know the best is yet to come.Our country must continue to serve as a model of prosperity and freedom. Pursue the principles we have stood for at home and abroad, and our children, and children’s children, will inherit the Canada we know and love so dearly. As I bid farewell to the Parliament of Canada, and prepare for the next chapter of my life, my eternal thanks to the constituents of Calgary Heritage, to the members of the Conservative Party, and to all Canadians for having given me the honour of serving the best country in the world.May God bless all of you and may God bless Canada. https://www.facebook.com/RtHonStephenHarper/

Il y a vingt-cinq ans aujourd’hui, le Parlement ukrainien a déclaré son indépendance de l’Union soviétique.  Les Canadiens peuvent être fiers que nous ayons été le premier pays occidental à reconnaître la souveraineté de l’Ukraine et, en cet anniversaire historique, je souhaite mes meilleurs vœux à la population de l’Ukraine et à la communauté ukrainienne du Canada.Malheureusement, les célébrations d’indépendance de l’Ukraine ont lieu à un moment de défis sans précédent pour la souveraineté et l’avenir de l’Ukraine. L’occupation illégale par la Russie de la Crimée et de certaines parties de l’Ukraine orientale se poursuit et le régime Poutine brandit la menace d’une escalade à une fréquence alarmante.La population ukrainienne fait preuve d’une force et d’une détermination remarquables depuis le quart de siècle où elle a choisi l’indépendance pour son avenir.  Les Ukrainiens font aussi des sacrifices déchirants pour défendre leur liberté, des innocents civils tués sur le Maïdan aux hommes et femmes en uniforme qui, sur leur propre territoire, continuent à perdre la vie pratiquement tous les jours en raison de l’agression militaire russe continue.Bien que le temps passe, le monde ne doit pas fermer les yeux sur les agissements du régime Poutine.  Maintenant plus que jamais, nous devons répéter que cela prenne cinq mois ou cinquante ans, nous n’allons jamais reconnaître l’occupation illégale par la Russie de la Crimée et de toute autre partie de l’Ukraine.Alors que nous soulignons aujourd’hui l’important anniversaire de l’indépendance de l’Ukraine, nous devons rester aux côtés de la population ukrainienne alors qu’elle se bat pour son avenir. https://www.facebook.com/RtHonStephenHarper/

Twenty-five years ago today, the Parliament of Ukraine declared independence from the Soviet Union.  Canadians are rightly proud that ours was the first Western country to recognize Ukraine’s sovereignty, and on this historic anniversary I extend my greetings and best wishes to the people of Ukraine and the Ukrainian-Canadian community.  Unfortunately, today’s celebration of Ukraine’s independence occurs at a time of unprecedented challenges to Ukraine’s sovereignty and future.  The illegal Russian occupation of Crimea and parts of eastern Ukraine continues and the Putin regime threatens further escalation with alarming frequency.   The Ukrainian people have shown remarkable strength and determined resolve in the quarter century since they chose independence as their future.  Ukrainians have also made heart-wrenching sacrifices in defence of their freedom, from the innocent civilians murdered in the Maidan to those Ukrainian men and women in uniform who, on their own soil, continue to lose their lives on a near-daily basis as the result of ongoing Russian military aggression. Though time may pass, the world must not turn a blind eye to the actions of the Putin regime.  Now more than ever we must recommit that whether it takes five months or fifty years we will never recognize the illegal Russian occupation of Crimea or any other part of Ukraine.  As we mark today’s important anniversary of Ukraine’s independence we must continue to stand with the people of Ukraine as they struggle for their future. https://www.facebook.com/RtHonStephenHarper/

Today, I met with His Excellency the Governor General and he has agreed that Parliament should be dissolved.  Canadians will go to the polls on October 19.A national election is not a popularity contest.  It is about leadership on the big issues that affect all Canadians: the economy and our country’s security.It’s a serious choice between proven, real-world experience and a dangerous approach that has failed before and is failing in other countries.Today, the global economy remains uncertain and unstable.  The European debt crisis continues to unfold, China is experiencing a significant economic downturn, and economic recovery in the U.S. continues to be slower than anticipated.  These events abroad impact us here at home.  Canada has continued to perform well compared to other G7 countries, but we cannot forget our focus or lose our course. Now is not the time for the kinds of hazardous economic schemes that are doing so much damage elsewhere in the world.  Now is the time to stay on track and stick to our plan.On the international front, we are facing increased threats from jihadi terrorists who have carried out terrorist attacks in Canada and threatened Canadians by name.Now is not the time for political correctness, inexperienced governance or an ideological unwillingness to act.  Now is the time to face those who threaten us with moral clarity, strength and resolve.I am asking Canadians to judge who has the proven experience today to keep our economy strong and our country safe. https://www.facebook.com/RtHonStephenHarper/

I know Ryan Meili well. His exceptional service in the field of medicine, where he has walked the talk on helping the neediest of the needy, is a shining example of the depth and breadth of the social commitment of this exceptional human being. Winning back a Conservative seat, as he recently did so convincingly, is emblematic of his ability to rally support across Saskatchewan and form a strong, progressive NDP government that puts people first. Ryan has the credibility, experience and expertise to be seen as a Premier in waiting. He would be a national player with an extraordinary ability to speak to the complex environmental, social and economic issues of our times.Saskatchewan deserves a leader with a clear vision that he will deliver on when he forms government. Ryan Meili is that leader.//Je connais bien Ryan Meili. Sa grande expérience dans le domaine de la médecine mise au service des plus démunis est un parfait exemple de son dévouement et de son engagement social exceptionnel.Enlever une circonscription aux conservateurs comme il l'a fait récemment de façon si convaincante, témoigne de sa capacité de rallier les gens de la Saskatchewan et de sa volonté de former un gouvernement néo-démocrate fort et progressiste, dont les citoyens sont la priorité.Ryan a la crédibilité, l'expérience et l'expertise nécessaires pour devenir premier ministre.  Il sera un homme politique canadien incontournable pouvant discuter d’enjeux complexes actuels qu’ils soient environnementaux, sociaux ou économiques.La Saskatchewan mérite un chef ayant une vision claire qui respectera ses engagements lorsqu'il formera le gouvernement. Ryan Meili est ce chef. https://www.facebook.com/TomMulcair/

I recently had the honour of attending the premier of "Secret Path", the profoundly moving true story about Chanie Wenjack, a child who runs away from a residential school, and tries to walk over 600 kilometres back home. As Gord Downie said, "his story is Canada's story." Understanding this dark part of Canada's history - the tragedy of residential schools - will help us on the road to reconciliation. The film will be broadcast by CBC on Sunday, October 23, 2016, at 9pm. I encourage all Canadians to watch it and reflect.—J'ai récemment eu l'honneur d'assister à la première de «  Secret Path », l'histoire vraie et profondément touchante de Chanie Wenjack, un enfant qui s'est enfui d'un pensionnat indien et qui a tenté de parcourir à pied plus de 600 kilomètres pour rentrer chez lui. Comme l'a dit Gord Downie, "son histoire est celle du Canada". Une meilleure compréhension de cette sombre partie de l'histoire du pays – la tragédie des pensionnats indiens – nous aidera sur le chemin de la réconciliation. Le film sera diffusé à la CBC le dimanche 23 octobre 2016 à 21 h. J’encourage tous les Canadiens à le regarder et à y réfléchir. https://www.facebook.com/TomMulcair/

#EveryChildMatters  In 1973, when Phyllis Webstad was just six years old, she was taken from her home and sent to the St. Joseph Mission residential school.  On her first day of school her clothes were taken from her, including a brand new orange shirt her grandmother had given her.Orange Shirt Day honours Phyllis and all of the Indigenous children who had so much taken from them by the Residential School system. Understanding this dark chapter in our history is an important first step towards healing.Wear orange tomorrow to come together in the spirit of reconciliation and hope for a better future for all. https://www.facebook.com/TomMulcair/

We asked members of our Montreal team for their thoughts on what inclusion means to them in 2017: "I believe that each one of us is born with a superpower. But now imagine if we all had the same exact superpower, they wouldn't be so super anymore. It's our differences that make us super." – Edmund, Frank And Oak Creative DirectorShop our new made-in-Montreal "And" collection and $5 from each purchase will go to Equitas, an association that works to eradicate the causes of poverty and build a world based on the principles of justice, equality and respect in Canada and around the world: www.frankandoak.com/and #WeSayAnd #FrankAndOak https://www.facebook.com/frankandoak/

We asked members of our Montreal staff for their thoughts on what inclusion means to them in 2017: "You have to fight on many fronts when you are a minority trying to feel included. I think one thing I learned in the past couple of years is that it starts with your immediate circle. Identify and denounce the micro-aggressions that make you feel uncomfortable and watch your surroundings change. Soon enough, you’ll be with people who praise and respect your differences." — Giuliana, CRM SpecialistShop our new made-in-Montreal "And" collection and $5 from each purchase will go to Equitas, an association that works to eradicate the causes of poverty and build a world based on the principles of justice, equality and respect in Canada and around the world: www.frankandoak.com/and #WeSayAnd https://www.facebook.com/frankandoak/

TORONTO'S MUSICAL UNDERGROUNDS is UP AND RUNNING  today, tomorrow, and Sunday 12-5 at the Gladstone Hotel -- and of course ALL NIGHT LONG on Friday as part of Long Winter!https://www.facebook.com/events/1502539869860242/Come get cozy with: * Over 4,654 hours of Mechanical Forest Sound's cassette archives of shows from lost venue/performing spaces in Toronto* Paul Petro Contemporary Art's incredible collection from Will Munro's life and the Vazaleen years* Northside Hip Hop and the Masterplan Show's Toronto 90's hip hop archives* Lyndall Musselman's documentary and records from the Who's Emma scene of the late 90s/early 2000s...and more photographs, archives, and artifacts from Toronto's alt music and arts scenes of the past four decades https://www.facebook.com/torontolongwinter/

CALL FOR ARTISTS:LONG WINTER is an inter-arts event series committed to programming work from artists across multiple disciplines and at all stages of their career. The works commonly featured at Long Winter are installation-based, but also commonly use projections, immersive dance and light projects as well sculpture, paintings and other. In addition to the goal of representing a range of distinct work from the broader community, we are especially interested in creative approaches to filling the space, experimenting with audience perception and experience. We are currently seeking submissions in the following areas:Video/MultimediaDance/Performance/Spoken WordSound artVisual artInstallationTo submit please send an artist bio and a description of your practice/work/project to torontolongwinterarts@gmail.com https://www.facebook.com/torontolongwinter/

*BLOG POST* The benefits of performing in a community ensemble are plentiful. Music is, in my opinion, based on collaboration and connection. New ideas and projects come from the collaboration of two like minds. The standard community ensemble or band has about forty members, providing many opportunities for networking and planning new projects. They’re also ideal for people who work full time, as they often rehearse once or twice a week. Combine that with a generally laid back atmosphere, and they become a great way to unwind after a week of work. Read more below! https://www.facebook.com/LongMcQuade/

Did you know that we have started carrying EarthQuaker Devices?  Well if that wasn't enough good news for one day, today is also launch day for their latest pedal, the Data Corrupter!  The Data Corrupter is a monophonic analog PLL harmonizer with modulation. It takes your input signal and brutally amplifies it into a crushing square wave fuzz tone that is then multiplied, divided and modulated to create a wild, yet repeatable, three-voice guitar synthesizer. Shop now:  https://www.long-mcquade.com/91916/Guitars/Guitar-Effects/EarthQuaker-Devices/Data-Corrupter.htm https://www.facebook.com/LongMcQuade/

Lucy | Pure Bassett Hound | 28 kg | Female | 9 years old Temperament: sweet, affectionate, loving and hilarious! Activity level: low to moderate - true “active chill” kind of girl. Loves to walk/adventure for hours but will nap/chill at home. Vetting: vaccinated (core vaccines); 4dx bloodwork negative for heartworm & three tick borne diseases (Ehrlichia/Anaplasma and Lyme); Wellness blood test (normal); CBC (Complete Blood Count) relatively normal (neutrophils slightly elevated due to dental issues which should be resolved post dental surgery); fecal (negative), dewormed; flea/tick prevention given, spayed, microchipped. Surgical history - growth removal (4 removed and sent out for histopathology; benign) and lump on chest is a suspected to be a lipoma. Dental Health Procedure performed (clean and polish) with 11 teeth extracted. Housebroken: yes!Good with dogs: incredible! Good with cats: not tested. Prey drive: none. Good with children: amazing kid dog! Even loves toddlers! Separation anxiety: whines and howls when left alone for the first 20-30 minutes. Lucy is loud so apartment/condos not recommended. Crate trained: not needed.Resource guarding: ZERO! Barky/noisy: very vocal. She likes to talk, will whine initially in new environments and when she is excited lets out happy howls and yodels (especially when she is playing with puppies). All of her vocalizations are adorable- not annoying and are very much a part of her dynamic and darling personality. Leash etiquette: pulls initially due to excitement and then settles into walk wonderfully! Leash reactivity: none. Transportation: whines in the car, not tested on public transit.*Lucy’s bio may change as we get to know her better.*Comes with 6 weeks of pet insurance - $500 coverage. #WeloveLucy. Like LOVE her. There is no love greater than the love we have for this older but exquisite girl. She is absolute perfection. Lucy was surrendered just before Christmas to CCR as her owner passed away. Lucy was LOVED by her late dad (Godspeed❤️) and the love just continued with her foster family. This girl has never experienced any kind of abuse and has zero triggers that could cause alarm. She would be great in a home with toddlers, or kids of any age. The only negatives we have encountered are: Lucy is literally obsessed with food. Obsessed. Lucy she has zero resource guarding and will allow toddlers to take her food away without issue. She loves food so much she may counter surf occasionally (yet not successfully due to her short and stout legs). Lucy will howl when left alone but stops soon after and shows zero destructive tendencies. Oh! And she is a bit (well a lot) overweight however she has begun losing a few pounds in her current foster home (7.8 lbs in 2 weeks!) and will continue to do so with her awesome weight loss program which is easy to follow. Instead of joining GoodLife just adopt Lucy and follow her diet program this January- #Lucydiet. Even though Lucy is a bigger girl weighing in at 28 kg she follows her foster mama around like a small dog..... in fact she IS a small dog in a big dog body. Lucy’s most fav thing to do is go on walks. And HOT DOG she can walk! The minute that leash comes out of hiding she is so excited!  Good luck getting a leash on her for her exuberance is inspiring and she will howl, jump and prance all over the place which will commence the first part of her (and your) workout #catchthecutebitchifyoucan! Lucy will initially pull once out and about but quickly calms and walks perfectly beside her human. Lucy loves rubs and cuddles - and will occasionally give kisses. That lovely soft belly will beckon you to rub it and that sweet nose will demand adoration! Affectionate people need only apply. Lucy is the gentlest soul.....she loves everyone - adult, kid, toddler, dog and even evil squawking nippy Cockatoo. Her most fav kinda thing though......are PUPPIES! If you let her play with a puppy....any puppy that little bum won’t stop shaking while her tail wags a mile a minute as she jumps for joy letting out little yodels of happiness (yes...Lucy is very vocal) #puppyobsessedporkchop😜.At night, Lucy will sleep next to you in a comfy doggie bed but prefers to sleep in bed next to you if she can fit #Californiakingcomfortneeded. She won’t have any accidents so not to worry while you enjoy your beauty sleep. Lucy does snore so don’t apply if you require absolute silence and if she is not permitted to sleep next to her human she will howl all night long (full moon or not). So if you think that you can love this porky but delicious darling more than we do please apply at adopt@covetedcanines.org OR apply directly through covetedcanines.org/application https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

Happy one year Gotcha Day anniversary to Motley and his family! This little lion is so lucky to have such a loving and wonderful mom and dad 💕 here’s to so many more years playing with balls and being spoiled rotten!“We can’t believe it’s been a year since we’ve adopted Motley! We wanted to provide you and the Coveted Canines team with an update on how well he’s doing as a member of our family. Motley is an absolutely incredible dog, and he has fit into our family perfectly! We are continuing to learn more about him and his cute little ways; for example, how much he enjoys car rides, his love for toys (especially balls), and how loyal and loving he has become to Ryan and me. We are so happy that we made the decision to adopt Motley and welcome him into our furever home. It’s been extremely rewarding to see Motley transform from a shy, timid rescue to a playful and loving (and totally spoiled) dog with so much to offer. We love him so incredibly much! We really appreciate all of the work that you and the Coveted Canines team does for wonderful little dogs like Motley!” https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

Sunday night is New Year’s Eve, which means from Saturday to about Monday people will be in full celebration! With these celebrations comes fireworks, and for many of our wet-nosed best friends that means nights full of anxiety and fear. Even the most well adjusted dogs could surprise you and run away when fireworks start, so here are some great tips to keep your dogs safe and ensure that you all have a great start to the new year. Cheers! https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

Maya | female | 6 years | Chi Mix | 3.1 kg*Temperament: Cuddly, Friendly, Funny!*Activity Level: moderate.*Vetting: vaccinated (core vaccines plus Bordetella), 4dx bloodwork negative for heartworm & tick borne diseases (Ehrlichia/Anaplasma and Lyme), fecal - negative, dewormed, flea/tick prevention given, microchipped, and spayed. She also has bilateral luxating patellas which are not causing her any discomfort and some dental tartar which may result in a dental cleaning in her future.*Housebreaking: mostly. Not a fan of the snow*Good with dogs: yes, no issues *Kids: good with older children, likely fine with younger, gentler children*Good with cats: unknown but would likely be fine.*Small animals: so far is afraid of smaller animals*Separation Anxiety: yes, she gets anxious when you leave*Crate trained: Likely, but is not crated in foster*Resource guarding: no*Barky: Vocal, will not be suitable for a condo*Leash walking: great with etiquette but reactive to some other dogs  *Good in transit: great in the carWant a dog with the personality of a big dog, but not interested in cleaning up big dog poops? Never fear, Maya is here! She is not your average lap dog! All she wanted for Christmas was to come to Canada from Mexico to find her forever home, and we HAD to oblige. She's reactive on leash, so applicants should be prepared to seek some training support and learn techniques to work with her on that. However, her foster mom reports that this isn't a big worry for her! She's good with dogs when introduced properly and so she would make a great second (or third) dog! She LOVES her people, so if you're retired or work from home, Maya is INTO IT.FYI, Maya fully intends to claim her spot next to you in bed, so if you're not into midnight puppy cuddles, she's not your girl. Her Foster mama says her personality changes everyday as she becomes more comfortable, so if you want to see this beauty of a girl come out of her shell to be the dog she was born to be, step right up and send us an email: Adopt@covetedcanines.org OR apply directly through www.covetedcanines.org. Start your 2018 off right and opt to adopt! https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

Little Bear says “hope you had a great Xmas!”. Caley and her amazing family know the joy in adopting a senior dog. Bear has become the love of their lives. We will soon be posting many seniors up for adoption. December is know by vets as “Dump December” where people don’t want to have to deal with their seniors over Christmas so many are euthanized. We received many emails regarding gorgeous seniors and took in as many as we could as seniors cost much more to vet, but the adoption fees are much lower. Please open your hearts to a senior dog. The experience will pay for itself a thousand times over in love, happiness, and the knowledge that you’re changing the life of a deserving dog forever. https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

Chiquita/female/1 year/Chi Mix/11 lbs | APPLICATIONS CLOSED *Temperament: sweet, affectionate, happy! *Activity Level: low-medium.*Vetting: vaccinated (core vaccines plus Bordetella), 4dx bloodwork negative for heartworm & tick borne diseases (Ehrlichia/Anaplasma and Lyme), fecal - negative, dewormed, flea/tick prevention given, microchipped, and spayed. X- rays on her knees revealed bilateral luxating patellas; due to her young age our vet is not concerned that this will cause her long term effects (the left knee is a grade 1-2 but the right is more likely to be a grade 3 because it’s not as easily felt on palpation - it doesn’t just pop in and out - meaning it’s a more permanent medial Luxation).*Housebreaking: mostly.*Good with dogs: yes!*Kids: yes, gentle children:) *Good with cats: unknown but would likely be fine.*Small animals: unknown but would like be fine.*Separation Anxiety: no!*Crate trained: yes!*Resource guarding: no!*Barky: no but whines a little when you initially leave her.*Leash walking: great!  Give it up for our darling supreme Chiquita. This little gal hails from the sunny streets of Mexico and hasn't quite wrapped her head around this whole "winter thing" we got going on up here in Canada. She's had a couple accidents while learning to housetrain cause of it, so patience is a virtue! HOWEVER, she's into the outdoors in general, so hallelujah to that! This little bean can be easily intimidated at first, but holds her own when playing with dogs bigger that her (which, let's face it, is most dogs). She also presents as timid to strangers, but if you give her your lap, she'll give you her love! Busy streets can make her nervous, but with some positive reinforcement (ALL the treats), she'd do just fine.She's crate trained, but you won't need it, she's not destructive in the least! However, it'll help you nail her housetraining down! And you condo dwellers, she's QUIET. Her fosters tell us a quieter home that's not all parties and chaos is what's best for this bean!You want in? Send us an email! Adopt@covetedcanines.org OR apply directly through www.covetedcanines.org https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

We are gushing over this pupdate on the beautiful Tulip. This sweet flower is so happy in her home 🌷“As our first snow storm here and Tulip is experiencing her first snow, I thought I would send you an update!  Tulip is such a wonderful dog.  She has brought so much to our lives that we can’t imagine life without her.  She truly loves love!  Both Jennabee and Tulip enjoy each other’s company and play and sleep together.  There are no issues of conflict or aggression.  Though Jennabee has taught Tulip to bark at other dogs on walks which is very annoying!  Tulip and I went to puppy training at Pet Smart in the fall and she was so smart and caught on so quickly that we stopped going as I was bored.  She “looks” at me, “waits”, “comes” and “sits” all on command.  She is a scavenger, will find food out on walks and won’t let it go and gobbles it up.  She has grown a beautiful thick coat and willingly goes for grooming.   She is still such a cuddler and we love it.  I think John loves it the most and she knows it.  If we don’t give her a rub she will hit us in the face for attention!  My guess is she is about 14 pounds now, a little chubby but she goes for long walks and is now enjoying running free at Rosedale golf course. Just wanted to let you know how much we love Tulip and it really was the perfect match.  She is a lovely part of our life.” https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

We know how tempting it can be to buy a puppy as a holiday gift for your loved one. They’ve been looking at cute dog videos on Facebook for quite sometime and are always making remarks about wanting one so badly! We beg of you to please not buy puppies as Christmas presents. Dogs are living, loving creatures who require and deserve a lifetime of commitment. The decision making process should be something taken on by every member of the family together to ensure that you are ALL ready for a new dog and everything that comes with it. The urge to buy that “perfect” puppy also supports bad breeders and puppy mills. This holiday season, if you’re looking to gift something live, we suggest a succulent 😉 https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

Congratulations to Katie, now Penny, on her adoption! We’re so happy for her.“You’ll be happy to know Penny has settled in great. She loves to sleep in (haha) and hog the bed! She loves anywhere between 3-4 walks a day and I am proud to say we’ve had no accidents in the house in quite some time as she now knows how to let us know when she needs out. She LOVES people and is super popular in the neighbourhood and at the park. Penny is extremely affectionate with people and loves being around other dogs. She has a mighty bark but only barks at other dogs when she wants to play. Penny is a great dog to have around the house. She loves sleeping and playing with her toys and loves a good cuddle on the couch. She also enjoys watching Planet Earth haha. Over the past few weeks, we’ve really seen Pennys personality come to light. She’s so playful and kind. She loves a treat and will even sit nicely when you offer her one. She also loves her Kong and rubber bone. She’s a great little walker and loves to say hi to people and dogs on our walks. She loves her buddy belt and new winter jacket. We love her and truly found the perfect dog. We’ve met a few other dogs from Coveted Canines at the park and it’s so nice to see that others have found their forever dogs through this rescue as well.We are truly in love - Penny was the best addition. Thank you to all of you for everything. We have one happy puppy :)” https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

Our Texas momma Abbott has settled into her new home with a beautiful new name... congratulations to Poppy on her adoption! She is so lucky to get such a beautiful family to call her own.“My husband and I picked Poppy up Friday evening from the best foster mom ever, Kristy! We returned to London and planned on taking things very slow over the weekend. Poppy was so incredibly shy and skittish that I kept her double leashed on walks in my yard and single leashed in the house, just in case she made a dash for the door. It quickly became a nuisance indoors as the cats would chase her loose leash! Poppy was casually welcomed by Sophie, Scooter and Teddy. She definitely was taking cues from the dogs. Poppy spent her first night in her closed crate, her preference. She ate sparingly and did all her business outside, reluctantly releasing what she'd held for 24 hours! After that though, she seemed to really open up! We purposely kept things quiet again last night and she chose to join Sophie, Teddy and me on the loveseat to watch the hockey game.Today has been incredible so far! I so wish you were here this morning to see the shenanigans! Poppy slept in our room last night but she didn't want to go in her crate so I figured I'd just roll up the rug, remove the shoes on the floor and hope for the best. She eventually slept in her crate for the night but with the door open. No accidents and a peaceful night. She woke up when the cats scratched at the door at 7:30 demanding breakfast. She is like a different dog this morning! Sooooo happy to see me, wagging her tail! We went directly out for our leashed yard walk and she immediately peed and pooped! We came in for a nice breakfast. I went back up to my room to get her pink dog bed and Poppy, Sophie and Teddy all followed. Sophie and Teddy started playing on my bed and Poppy was interested. She allowed me to pick her up and put her on the bed too. Well, it was an invitation to Nirvana! This girl loves the king size Tempurpedic! Ha! She rolled and rubbed herself all over it and then up to me enjoying booty rubs! Then she engaged in the best appropriate play with Sophie and Teddy! I wished I'd had been able to video  it for you but my iPad was downstairs and I didn't want to interrupt the games. It was so wonderful and confirms that we've all done the right thing! So great I'm almost moved to tears! Well, no almost....I'm full on crying now. 😍🌈❤️😘🍀Afterwards, we went out for another yard walk and if she hadn't been on her leash I'm sure she would have been running and romping with the gang. I ran with her and for the first time, in her mind, I was running with her, not chasing her! I know we could have set backs along the road but I'm so encouraged! I think so much of it has to do with her observance of the gang and knowing that I'm safe, a source of food, love and comfort. Pretty amazing. I'm proud of my gang for being so welcoming.. I thought they'd be ok but I wasn't expecting exceptional. My cats have been right in there too. Old man Scooter gets tired just watching the activity! Poppy, Ted and Sophie are so well suited to each other. As you can tell, we are all feeling really great this morning!I really feel that so much of this success is due to the amazing care Poppy received from Kristy. Everything Kristy did was well thought out and measured to ensure a good transition for Poppy. She had the additional task of weaning the pups and dealing with Momma dog hormones! Kristy took Poppy to work to additionally socialize her and expose her to new situations. Kristy brought Poppy to London for a visit so that moving here wouldn't be her first exposure to my house, pets, people and yard. Also, Kristy's own dogs assisted in an amazing supportive way to show Poppy the business of being a well adjusted dog in Canada!We all feel beyond blessed to have Poppy and so many new friends through Coveted Canines. We can't even begin to express our heartfelt appreciation for all that every single one of you have done to assist in this adoption. Every person involved has played a critical roll in the success of this adoption, matter how how brief the interaction or involvement. Please share our sentiments with everyone as I'm sure there are many I haven't had any communication with. It truly does take a village!I'll send pictures as soon as I have some good ones. So far they've all been very dark or I've been in my p.j.s! Here is one though from last night as we all spent Saturday night watching the hockey game. Welcome to life in Canada, Poppy!With sincere thanks,Sally” https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

Congratulations to Zeus on his adoption, he is the perfect addition to this beautiful family.“It's been a whirlwind of a week but man oh man are we ever in love with this pup!  Kristin's description of him was 100% bang on.  His very relaxed during the day, but when the kids get home from school he can sure mix it up with the best of them!  Although he doesn't mind going in his crate during the day, and even chooses to hang out there some times, he did have a very hard first 2 nights.  Last night was much better, I waited for him to fall asleep and then he only woke up once during the night.  He loves his food, his treats and his new toys.  Was a big day for him today.  We went on our first actual walk (so far we've been hanging out in the backyard as he was too nervous to go very far) and we couldn't go more than two steps without someone stopping to give him some love.  He also met my sister's dog today, and our sweet little puppy actually turned into a bit of a bully LOL so we'll have to get him some doggie play dates pretty quick to learn who to play nice.  Needless to say, he's been conked out since 8 pm.” https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

Look at this beautiful family! Congratulations to Wally who gets a clean bill of health and his own fantastic family ☺️“After medical fostering Wally for 5 months, we are thrilled to adopt this silly boy into our family! Medical fostering was challenging but extremely rewarding as we watched Wally grow healthier and stronger. After 5 long months of routine consisting of regular bathing, different medications and frequent vet visits, Wally finally received his health clearance. Everyone at coveted canines and DAH has been nothing short of amazing - we were so glad to have rescued our first family pup. Preciosa | Shepherd mix | 25 lbs | Female | ~10 years old | Blind and 80% deafTemperament: sweet, affectionate, loving.Activity level: low. Vetting: vaccinated (core vaccines plus Lepto & Bordetella); 4dx bloodwork negative for heartworm & three tick borne diseases (Ehrlichia/Anaplasma and Lyme); CBC (Complete Blood Count) normal; Wellness blood test (normal); Fecal (negative), dewormed; flea/tick/heartworm prevention given, spayed and microchipped. Preciosa is blind, partially deaf, has some arthritis and minimal tarter on her teeth. Housebroken: yes!Good with dogs: great with large dogs but not with small dogs. Good with cats: no.Prey drive: yes - strong prey drive with cats and small dogs.Good with children: easily startled, older dog savvy kids.Separation anxiety: whines occasionally when left alone- has barked on two occasions when foster was out. Crate trained: not needed.Resource guarding: none observed.Barky/noisy: no.Leash etiquette: great!Transportation: good in car, not tested on public transit.*Preciosa’s bio may change as we get to know her more.*Comes with 6 weeks of pet insurance - $500 coverage. Preciosa certainly lives up to the meaning of her name! She is one precious señorita!Preciosa is all the way from the streets of Mexico, but you’d never guessed she lived rough since she is so sweet and affectionate with everyone she meets. She loves to be with people and is quick to give lots of kisses to everyone. She enjoys having a generous dose of pets and belly rubs! This sweet señorita just loves to be showered with affection.Due to being blind and hard of hearing, Preciosa has some limitations in her mobility. She cannot do stairs and takes a bit of time to adjust and learn new surroundings.Preciosa loves large dogs! She just wants to cuddle up to them and follow them around, however she can’t distinguish small dogs from prey. Regardless of her limitations in sight, she loves her walks and checking out the smells in the local park. For being an older gal, she still has a spring in her step!Even though she’s blind this girl is one precious sweetheart just looking for someone to shower with her affection! If you want this precious package of love, apply at: covetedcanines.org/application https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

Spanky took the last step of his long journey to his forever home, when Alan and Tammy Mayer picked him up from his foster mum, Cynthia, and brought him home.  Now Spanky will be dividing his time between his apartment in the Beaches and his log cabin in the country near Kingston. The first night Spanky kept close to Tammy and Alan.  He slept at the end of the bed with them, but couldn’t help wiggling closer and closer, giving lots of licks until he nuzzled his way right onto the pillow between them.  That’s how he earned an affectionate nickname, “the Weasel” because he not only acts like one, but sometimes even resembles one, too! Nobody got much sleep the first night and around sunrise the next morning, Spanky started exploring his new neighbourhood by walking the short block from his new home to the boardwalk by the beach.  He sat on a bench and marvelled at all the dogs and people who were walking and running past him. He was just upset he wasn’t allowed to meet his liveliest new neighbours, the squirrels! Spanky soon met other new neighbours around his home.  Everyone he greeted, without exception, couldn’t help remarking on how cute and adorable he was.  Then a day after he moved in, Spanky found a new toy that had been left on his doorknob.  There was no note or card because it had been given to him by another dog named Freddy, a neighbour and fellow graduate of Coveted Canines who lives with his guardians, Ashton and Angie.  The little white stuffed lamb is now his favourite toy and he prances around with it in his mouth all day long and takes it to bed every night. But Spanky’s days haven’t been all play and no work.  He’s had a couple of sessions with Dan, from Golden Rule Training, and with his help, Alan and Tammy have taught Spanky to come when called, sit, and walk with a loose leash. (Well, sort of, more work needed on that one.)   Although, only 11 and a half months old, Spanky is considering a career as a therapy dog.  His gentle, loving, playful personality makes him a natural. Foster mum Cynthia suggested the possibility and Spanky has already taken steps in that direction by accompanying Alan to his office. Spanky greets the people who come to counselling with great enthusiasm, and with his jumps, licks and wriggles, they feel better even before they enter the room. Indeed Spanky is proof of the old adage that “there is no psychiatrist in the world like a puppy licking your face” and he goes about his job with gusto.  People sometimes want Spanky to sit in their lap, which he does agreeably and when he looks up into their eyes with his soulful gaze, it truly seems to help their troubles melt away. Spanky is having new experiences every day.  When Tammy took him to the beach and right down to the edge of Lake Ontario, Spanky looked completely mystified and somewhat astounded.  He’d never seen such a big bowl of water! When he was in his foster home, Spanky made friends with Cynthia’s other dogs, Milou, Lucy and Asta.  Alan and Tammy have wondered whether he missed playing with his old friends. Fortunately, a doggie daycare centre called No Bones About It, is just a few doors down from where Spanky lives and he’s had a chance to spend a few minutes there meeting and greeting the other dogs.  Next week he’ll spend a little more time with them until it’s clear he’s comfortable visiting every so often. As you know, Spanky had an operation on his leg a few weeks ago.  For a few days after he moved in with Tammy and Alan, he was favouring his foot a little on his walks, but now you can barely tell one leg from the other!  He is even able to support his whole body on his sore leg when he lifts his leg to pee. He’s had another checkup with his vet who is very happy with the way Spanky’s leg is healing. He has encouraged Tammy and Alan to let Spanky run up and down stairs all he wants. While waiting for the vet, Spanky met another dog named Freddy (formerly Mario) who also came to Canada courtesy of Coveted Canines. Next week, Spanky will ride in the car out to the country to spend a few days exploring the land around the cabin. He’ll walk the country dirt roads on-leash, sniffing for deer, fox, quail, bunnies and other wild, mysterious inhabitants! Spanky is so sweet, loveable and playful, he hasn’t had much trouble at all settling into his new home and daily routine.  He may have had a tough start to his young life, but he hardly ever shows it.  As for Alan and Tammy, they are thrilled beyond measure to have a rare and special pup like Spanky in their life, especially after losing their beloved old dog, Shiloh, within the last year.  We’d like to express our deepest gratitude to Carly and Cynthia and every single person who helped rescue Spanky and gave him a hand along the way.  We are especially thankful to all those who contributed to his operation and we want you to know that because of you, this lovely little dog is now healthy and free to go about his happy way. https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

The only thing this Bandit is stealing is hearts! Congratulations to him and his funny family 😂“This is Kirk, Bandit's dad.  Other names for him are getting tossed around; Leif (Lief Ericcson, a real explorer), DK (short for Drama King; he is a full body howler in a closed crate), Ragnar (he took the crate one time like a warrior).  Bandit is still sticking.He's doing really well.  There is so much stuff around our neighbourhood, so much stuff in our home to explore that his 2 sec attention span tank keeps getting filled. He has a radar for attacking things he shouldn't so we need to keep an eye on him and put ALL precious and dangerous things out of reach.  You guys are right to insist on conforming to a strict puppy proofing.  It's a good guage for ownership preparedness.  It proves to be a small effort compared to taking care of a puppy and if you can't do it, maybe a puppy is not the best thing 4 u.It's been a while since we raised a puppy.  I was younger then.  Coming to terms with how old I have become is sobering. Bandit is an energizer bunny.  His battery is small but strong and recharges fast.  Play, train, play play play, try to eat furniture, turn your back for a second and how did you find that?, rest, eat, drink, pee, poop, go after dirt, leaves, pebbles....repeat.  You don't need a gym to take care of him.He is very active, very clever, very smart.  Explores everything and watches you.  He might steal the car in his teens.  He does very well with commands. Sit, lie down. Heals very well considering his age.  He behaves like a working dog, probably a guard dog, so I think we will focus his training to satisfy that. Waiting for his shot so we can freely take him to the park.  Puppy training starts after necessary shot and examination.Thanks for Bandit. Thanks for the opportunity to care for a 4 legged baby.  Very challenging but extremely rewarding.  Thanks to all you and crew have done for the puppies. If one is a handful I cannot imagine how a whole pack was.  Off to tug of war with Bandit.” https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

Has it been a year already?! Wow! Time sure does fly when you’re having fun. And by the sounds of it, Rudy is having a blast, becoming a world traveler, and charming the pants off of everyone she meets. This is what meant to be looks like. Here’s to a lifetime of great memories to come as a family. “I'm not sure how to begin to describe what a joy it is to have Rudy in our lives! This goofy little 5 pound snuggle bug makes us smile every day. From the way she delicately eats one piece of kibble at a time to how she wags her tail and rolls over for belly rubs, we are completely smitten with her. She loves adventure as much as we do, and happily hops into her car seat when it's time for a trip. (I've discovered I don't need to pack her bed, either. On the road, she'd much rather hang out in my suitcase!) In the past year, she's been to New York, Boston, Philadelphia, Vermont, Tennessee, Portland, Vancouver, Montreal, Ottawa and Calgary, making friends where ever she goes. We're looking forward to many more years with our little love. Thank you, Coveted Canines!” https://www.facebook.com/covetedcanines/

Behind the Scenes: The average day for our 400 experts at Systems Operations Control in Brampton, Ontario – including the Aircraft Routing Manager (ARM for short) pictured here – involves a long and varied list of tasks to keep our fleet in tip top shape to ensure the safest flight conditions for our passengers. Each playing their important part in our daily international operations, our highly-trained staff monitor precisely what our planes are doing, where they’ve been, and where they’re heading next. They’ll also organize all maintenance, including sourcing, shipping, and the necessary customs details required to ship needed parts internationally, helping make sure you can #FlyTheFlag all over the world. 📷  Laird Kay https://www.facebook.com/aircanada/

TIREZ LE MEILLEUR DE VOS MILLES!Le Programme de transport hospitalier de la Fondation Air Canada améliore le sort de familles partout au Canada et aide des enfants malades à s’épanouir.Voici le petit James, qui a reçu de l’aide dans le cadre du Programme de transport hospitalier de la Fondation Air Canada en raison du syndrome de Wiskott-Aldrich, une maladie génétique rare qui compromet son système immunitaire, dont il souffre. Pour en savoir plus sur le parcours de James, sélectionnez ce lien : www.aircanada.com/Fondation. Et n’oubliez pas : du 4 au 10 décembre, Aeroplan égalisera tous les dons de milles faits à à la Fondation jusqu’à concurrence de 500 000 milles. Joignez-vous à nous afin de soutenir des centaines d’enfants malades!Il est rapide et facile de donner des milles. Il suffit de faire un don en vous rendant à l’adresse suivante : www.aircanada.com/Fondation et de sélectionner la bannière en haut de page.Saisissez cette formidable occasion et partagez-là avec votre famille et à vos amis!Merci! https://www.facebook.com/aircanada/

Behind the Scenes: At Systems Operations Control, DXP is the in-house code for Flight Dispatcher. Our Flight Dispatchers are all trained in meteorology, a skill set which aids in developing flight plans that offer safer, smoother, more comfortable rides for our passengers. The job includes far more than just watching the weather: the Flight Dispatcher is at the heart of the action in constant contact with Pilots and Air Traffic Control (ATC). With a close eye on the details, they also monitor weight & balance while taking into account baggage loads, passenger counts, fuel requirements and cargo loads. 📷: Laird Kay https://www.facebook.com/aircanada/

Who says you can't eat trash?On March 1, 2017, hundreds of people came together savour "garbage" at Trashed & Wasted, an event in support of Second Harvest. With the goal of bringing awareness to reducing food waste, seven of Toronto's chefs got inventive at Wychwood Barns, using food odds and ends that might normally be discarded, to create some delicious bites.  Our very own Chef Chris Barrett and his team from Oliver & Bonacini Events and Catering served Grilled Bannock (using bannock dough ends) two ways:  1) with crispy prosciutto ends (hand shaved to use every bit left) with a mushroom duxelle (made with various mushroom stalks) and Parmesan rind espuma (made from rind ends from a block of Parmesan) and 2) brown butter cauliflower (purée made with stock and leaves) and toasted hazelnut crumbs (literally - nut crumbs from the bottom of the bag)It was a great evening, bringing awareness to reducing food waste - here are some highlights! https://www.facebook.com/OliverBonacini/

Our hearts go out to all who have been affected by the wildfires in British Columbia. We’re opening the doors to all 12 of our BC Clubs for anyone who has been affected by the fires. There are outlets to charge electric devices, change rooms, showers, and we will be providing towels, shampoo, conditioner, and soap to anyone in need, at no cost. Did you know that today is Learn Your Name in Morse Code Day? Here in Canada, we have some pretty incredible history when it comes to telecommunications. Guglielmo Marconi sent the first official transatlantic exchange of radio messages at Glace Bay, NS – now the location of Marconi National Historic Site! Explore the Wireless Hall of Fame where you can see instruments like those used in Marconi’s original transmissions. Learn more: ow.ly/3qVX30hHunt https://www.facebook.com/ParksCanada/

All aboard! 🚊 The cultural heart of Glacier National Park, Rogers Pass NHS Mount Revelstoke and Glacier national parks, offers a unique history of the Canadian Pacific Railway Company, and is a beautiful spot to explore for those who ❤️ to ski. But wait… Make sure not to forget your Winter Permit! #DYK? Glacier National Park is home to the world’s largest mobile avalanche control program! Together with the Canadian Armed Forces, Parks Canada conducts avalanche control with artillery to ensure safety of transportation throughout the park, resulting in daily openings and closures. In order to ski in this area, visitors must take part in the Winter Permit System. Learn more about how you can get your permit here: http://ow.ly/Vmnu30gV6eWTo celebrate #Canada150, we're featuring ALL of our 200+ places across our social media accounts. Stay tuned! https://www.facebook.com/ParksCanada/

[1 of 2] "We've always had an unofficial "who's the fastest bagel guy" competition. We take it pretty seriously, there are rules and all. The roller has one minute to roll as many bagels as he can, the bagels don't need to be perfect but they need to be able to be dunked in the water without opening and a previous champion has to be one of the judges.It started in the 70s with my dad. He rolled 40. Then Marco beat him with 42 a few years later. Then Sergio outdid them in the early 90s with 44 bagels rolled.In 97/98 I started training to break the record. I started organizing the event so that Joe, Marco and Sergio would be there to judge.At about that time, the Great Canadian Food network came in to film a segment about bagels with me. They asked who the fastest roller was and I told them I was going for the title the following day. They asked me if I could do it for them so they could film it. You only get one chance a year, so this was my one shot. I did it. I rolled 50 bagels.The only problem is that none of the previous champions were there, so to this day my record is still disputed. But it was filmed, so I'm the fastest bagel roller."    Vince Morena, Fastest Bagel Roller https://www.facebook.com/stviateurbagel/
